results:
Based on my search results, I can provide you with information about the translations of "Brave New World" into these languages, though complete chronological publication dates are not available for all translations.

Here's what I found about the translations of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World":

## German Translation
The novel was translated into German already in the year it was published, 1932, by Herberth E. Herlitschka under the title "Welt – wohin?" (World – Where to?)(no content)Later, in 1978, the East German publisher Das Neue Berlin published a new translation by Eva Walch entitled "Schöne neue Welt"

## French Translation  
The French edition is entitled "Le Meilleur des mondes" (The Best of All Worlds), an allusion to an expression used by the philosopher Gottfried Leibniz and satirised in Candide by Voltaire (1759)(no content)The novel was written in 1931 and published in 1932

## Spanish Translation
The Spanish translation is titled "Un mundo feliz" in every edition of the book(no content)There have been three translations into Spanish of Aldous Huxley's "Brave New World"

## Italian Translation
The Italian translation is titled "Il mondo nuovo"(no content)The Italian translation by Lorenzo Gigli was published by Mondadori in 1933

## Russian Translation
While I found references to Russian translations in some search results, I did not find specific publication date information for the first Russian translation.

## Chronological Summary
Based on the available information:

1. **1932**: German - "Welt – wohin?" by Herberth E. Herlitschka (same year as original publication)
2. **1932**: French - "Le Meilleur des mondes" (same year as original publication)  
3. **1933**: Italian - "Il mondo nuovo" by Lorenzo Gigli

For Spanish and Russian translations, while I found confirmation that they exist ("Un mundo feliz" for Spanish), I could not locate specific first publication dates in my search results to provide an accurate chronological ordering for these languages.

The novel was eventually translated into nineteen languages and continued to enjoy respectable sales throughout the remainder of the century
